summary: distinct() returns a collection containing only the unique items in the input collection.
Uniqueness is determined using the equals (=) operator.
If the input collection is empty, distinct() returns an empty collection.
The order of elements in the distinct() result is not guaranteed to be preserved.
isDistinct() returns true when all items are distinct; it is equivalent to count() = distinct().count().
If the input collection is empty, isDistinct() returns true.

todo: [ ] Implement parsing of distinct() and isDistinct() function calls.
[ ] Implement distinct() evaluation using equals (=) to remove duplicates.
[ ] Confirm equals semantics for complex types once object equality is supported.

cases.name: distinct on missing field returns empty
distinct on empty array returns empty
distinct on single item returns same
distinct on nested path collapses duplicates
isDistinct on missing field returns true
isDistinct returns true for unique items
